transcript.title: FOR PRESS: PM 26/1967 - ECONOMIC CONSULTATIONS
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS: P. M. No. 26/ 1967
ECONOMIC CONSULTATIONS
The Prime Minister with his other Ministers had
discussions this morning on the economic situation with representatives of
a group of national organisations representing industry and commerce.
Representatives who attended the meeting were
Mr. F. R. Curtis
Mr. F. G. May
Mr. F. J. McAvoy
Mr. J. P. Heffernan
Mr. T. B. C. Walker President, Associated Chambers of Manufactures
of Australia
Pres ident,
Associated Chambers of Commerce
of Australia
President, National Farmers Union of Australia
President,
Australian Primary Producers' Union
President, Australian Woolgrowers' and
Graziers' Council
Mr. L. H. Heaslip, OBEVice-President,
Australian Wool and Meat
Federation Producers'
Mr. R. H. S. Cavan
Mr. D. C. Watkins
Mr. N. W. Lawrance
Sir Theo Kelly, OBE Chairman, Australian Bankers' Association
President,
Master Builders' Federation of
Australia
Executive Member,
Federal Chamb er of Automotive
Industries
Acting President,
Australian Council of Retailers.
Mr. Holt said that the organisations had welcomed the
opportunity to inform the Government of their veiws of the current and
prospective developments in the various sectors of the economy represented
by them. The Government, for its part, had found the talks of great value
coming as they did before a consideration by the Cabinet at its meeting on
Wednesday of the present state of the economy.
This afternoon, Ministers will meet with representatives of
the Manufacturing Industries Advisory Council and the Export Development
Council and this evening with representatives of the Australian Council of
Trade Unions.
CANBERRA, 13th February, 1967. 67/ 0'., 7
